agenda.description: HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Homeland Security & Public Safety TIME & DATE: 8:00 AM, Wednesday, May 1, 2019 PLACE: E2.016 CHAIR: Rep. Poncho Nevárez ***Testimony will be limited to 2 minutes*** The order in which bills will be heard is at the discretion of the chair. HB 3057 Harris Relating to the appointment, powers, duties, rights, and privileges of special Texas constables. HB 4017 Calanni Relating to the eligibility for a handgun license of a person who is identified as a member of a criminal street gang. SB 71 Nelson | et al. Relating to the establishment of a statewide telehealth center for sexual assault forensic medical examination. SB 193 Perry | et al. Relating to waiving the fee for the issuance of a duplicate, modified, or renewed license to carry a handgun for school marshals. SB 284 Hinojosa Relating to disciplinary proceedings applicable to a licensed forensic analyst. SB 285 Miles | et al. Relating to information and outreach regarding hurricane preparedness and mitigation. SB 300 Miles Relating to indefinite quantity contracts for the provision of certain services to declared disaster areas following a natural disaster. SB 324 Huffman Relating to the disposition of a firearm seized from certain persons with mental illness. SB 363 Watson Relating to access to certain controlled substance prescription information. SB 406 Birdwell | et al. Relating to the carrying or storage of a handgun by a school marshal. SB 741 Hughes Relating to restrictive covenants regarding firearms or firearm ammunition. SB 799 Alvarado | et al. Relating to the creation of a business advisory council to provide advice on economic recovery following a disaster. SB 1804 Kolkhorst Relating to the entry into the Texas Crime Information Center of certain information regarding conditions of bond imposed in criminal cases involving family violence. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
